meanings.definition: To surpass in raving or speaking wildly.
meanings.sent1: She outraved all the other contestants with her passionate speech.
meanings.sent2: He outraved his friends with his enthusiastic storytelling.
meanings.sent3: The parrot outraved the noisy children by mimicking their loud voices.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outraved the cheering crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outraved the howling wind in intensity.

meanings.definition: Past tense of outrave: to have raved or spoken wildly beyond the norm.
meanings.sent1: They outraved everyone at the party with their hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent2: After the performance, she outraved all expectations with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent3: The cat outraved the barking dog by meowing loudly in response.
meanings.sent4: His anger outraved the usual calm demeanor he displayed.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outraved the twinkling stars in the night sky.
